title: Iran Orders Two-Day Shutdown Because of ‘Unprecedented’ Heat
description: The government announced a two-day public holiday, ordering all government agencies, banks and schools to close amid soaring temperatures that threatened public health and strained the power grid.

title: Drones Strike Moscow Building Twice in 48 Hours
description: The same building housing Russian government offices was hit twice within 48 hours.

title: U.K.’s New Alcohol Taxes Are Aimed at Keeping Pubs Open and Votes Flowing
description: The changes are the biggest shake-up to Britain’s alcohol levies in 140 years, according to a government whose leader was clearly on the campaign trail in announcing them.

title: Ukraine’s Grain Lifeline in Danube Ports Comes Under Russia Threat
description: Since the collapse of the Black Sea grain deal two weeks ago, small ports on the Danube River are the only shipping outlet for millions of tons of grain.

title: Chinese Zoo: This Is a Real Sun Bear, Not a Costume
description: “Some people think I look too human when I stand up,” the Hangzhou Zoo’s statement said, after a video prompted internet conspiracy theories. “I am a Malayan sun bear!”

title: Ousmane Sonko’s Arrest Sets Off New Round of Protests
description: Ousmane Sonko, a fiery figure with a loyal youth following, was charged with fomenting insurrection, and his party dissolved.

title: Under Hindu Nationalist Leaders, Sectarian Violence Flares in India
description: A gunman who killed Muslim train passengers and a Hindu march that turned riotous underscore how the partisan stances of India’s top Hindu leaders have given license to chaotic elements in the country.

title: A Stairway to Nowhere Sells for $32,000 in London
description: An entrepreneur saw what others didn’t and now owns the unused set of stairs, which are attached to the back of a suburban building.

title: UNESCO Recommends Venice for Endangered List
description: The United Nations’ culture agency is warning of twin perils to the historic city from mass tourism and climate change.

title: Niger Coup Is Backed by 2 Neighbors, Raising Risk of Wider Conflict
description: As France prepared to evacuate its citizens, Burkina Faso and Mali said they would take any military operation by other West African nations to reinstate the president as a “declaration of war.”

title: Kerala Lottery: India Sanitation Workers Win $1.2 Million Lottery
description: The winners, who are sanitation co-workers in India, each make just a few dollars a day. The jackpot will help them pay off crippling debts.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Drone Again Hits a Moscow Building Housing Russian Ministries
description: Ukrainian officials have become more open in their view that targets inside Russia are legitimate.

title: Construction to Break German Dependence on Russian Gas Hits a Snag: Wartime Bombs
description: The choreography of finding and clearing unexploded, decades-old munitions has become routine on Germany’s northern coast.

title: Mexico’s ‘Monster’ Trucks Show Cartels Taking Drug War to Next Level
description: Taking the monster truck concept to deadly new realms, cartels are modifying pickups with gun turrets, steel armoring and battering rams.

title: Solar Supply Chain Grows More Opaque Amid Human Rights Concerns
description: The global industry is cutting some ties to China, but its exposure to forced labor remains high and companies are less transparent, a new report found.

title: Anger Over ‘Barbenheimer’ in Nuclear-Scarred Japan
description: The Japanese subsidiary of Warner Bros. criticized what it called insensitive promotion of ‘Barbie’ by the company’s headquarters.

title: Typhoon Khanun Threatens Japan and China on Heels of Doksuri
description: Typhoon Khanun was barreling through the Pacific days after an earlier tropical cyclone, Doksuri, brought death and destruction to the region.

title: Aung San Suu Kyi Receives Partial Pardon in Myanmar
description: The civilian leader, who was ousted in a coup in 2021, has been serving a 33-year prison sentence. Five of the 19 convictions against her have now been overturned, state television said.

title: Russia’s Law Targeting Transgender People Sows Fear for L.G.B.T. Russians
description: A new law underscores how Vladimir V. Putin is increasingly using the war in Ukraine as justification for greater restrictions on L.G.B.T. life, portraying it as a consequence of deviant Western values.

title: Move Over, Men: Women Were Hunters, Too
description: Anthropologists are finding that women in modern foraging societies have played a major role in catching game.

title: Tuesday Briefing
description: The details of Ukraine’s drone strikes.
